data.title: Missoula's Cash Only Dive Bar.
data.text:
The Dirty Dollar is the typical dive bar. It is cash only, the type of place where you can throw your peanut shells on the floor (really can do that) while you play pool, darts, or just sit at the bar and watch the mix of people that wander in and out. 
The Dirty Dollar really the last of it's kind.

data.title: Road side rest stop with all the bells and whistles
data.text: A great place to take a break from the road during a long drive across Montana. There is a gas station with a convenience store, a huge gift shop with lots of unique souvenirs. A bar/restaurant, and nearby a stand selling Reiner cherries.

data.title: Cool
data.text: A cool place to stop! they have so many trinkets in the bar and the food is actually pretty good it's always consistently ok , not spectacular but a good place. if you're there in the winter time on snowmobiles it's a great place to warm up at the bar and have a cocktail then shop for stuff to take home to friends.

data.title: Not impressed at all!!
data.text: When we arrived they were pretty busy but had the sign turned to seat ourselves. We wanted a booth as we had our 4 year old grandson with us and it would be easier to sit at. When we asked if we could get a booth cleaned the very rude waitress said they were very busy and trying.  We just told her to nevermind then and sat at table 1. We then had to wait for someone to acknowledge that we had even sat down. Another waitress finally noticed us as she was clearing another table and said she could drop menus with us but did not leave us a child's menu. We then sat awhile longer before another waitress finally waited on us. She was the most friendly person that we experienced out of the 3 during our visit. She had only worked there 2 weeks though, so being new she didn't know much about the menu. When we finished I let our waitress know that the turkey on my chefs salad had a funny taste to it and either it was old or a brand that didn't taste that great, like real chemical like or something. Her boss must have heard my comment as the waitress came back with our credit card and receipt and told me her boss said the turkey had just been sliced. Either way, the food was edible, but nothing to write home about. My dad suggested we stop there on our way to Billings as he's been there before and went to school with the Lincoln kids in Libby. Needless to say, we won't go back and won't recommend it. The silver dollars are cool, but it's a tourist trap. Don't waste your time or money.

data.title: Fun night out
data.text: The Silver Dollar Bar is a Missoula institution. We had a fun time but I thought the bartender could have been nicer and a little less sarcastic. Just because we aren't a regular there doesn't mean we don't want to be treated like one. I would go back again though

data.title: It is what it is;  Kids loved it
data.text: A definite tourist spot full of souvenirs for kids and adults. The 6 and 8 year old grandsons each had $10 to spend and they had a ball deciding what they wanted.  The silver dollars in the bar are quite a sight to see.  My husband thought the ice cream was overpriced - I'm not sure but it hit the spot on a 90 degree day! There is a nice little restaurant and bar with slot machines.  Biker bliss! Lots of road warriors.  I have to say that the lady who helped the boys picked out their souvenirs couldn't have been nicer to them. Montana is chock-full of nice, friendly people.

data.title: great stop
data.text: So many little trinkets here.  Great souvenirs.  A lot of Montana in one little place.  Must stop.  Right off the freeway.

data.title: One of my favorite bars...
data.text: One of my favorite bars in Missoula.
